i opened this forum post the other day, but i know some people lurk here and not there. wondering if anyone here has advanced experience with chatflows (meaning custom JS coding):
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Tickets-Conversations/Add-a-pause-to-chat-bot/m-p/332422>

I haven’t played much with the chat bot code snippet but can you just put the `callback` function call into a `setTimeout`?  So it may look something like
```setTimeout(callback, 10000, responseJson)```
Happy to be here... I am new. I speak javascript btw :grin: ... fullstack (feathersjs/reactjs) now my 1st task is reverse email and phone lookup for my prospects hope I can get some help.

yeah that’s what i’ve been doing — i took out all of my callback code because i’d tried it about 3 or 4 places in that snippet. that’s when it started failing silently or for some reason being called *before* the previous step
the timeout would run, but not where i’d inserted it — before the previous step. which makes no sense.
then both messages would fire together after a 10 second delay.
and if i moved it elsewhere in the snippet, it would fail silently and just terminate the chatflow.

Hi,  i have created a dnd template and when i try to apply it to existing pages which have been created in the Design Manager, in can´t select the new template to apply it to that page. Is this not possible, or am i doing something wrong?

To be clear are you referring to a <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates|coded template> with a <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags/dnd-areas|dnd_area>?

If so review your <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates#template-annotations|Template Annotations> you likely need to update your `isAvailableForNewContent`
thanks Jon!
i checked, the template has   `isAvailableForNewContent: true` in it
and it is base on the dnd boilerplate template ( a coded template with dnd areas)

Asking the general marketing development hive mind: we are working on some redesigns and standardizing across our marketing website. Heated argument ensued as to what is better for secondary CTA design: *a secondary button or a hyperlink*. VP of marketing wants "what is more optimized for conversion".  From all your experience and research, any thoughts? Would love to come back with a definitive answer and put the discussion to bed.
Here's a secondary button from slack
and hyperlink style from servicenow

My 2 cents - it doesn't matter. One is meant to have more emphasis for the main intended user action and the secondary provides another option should the user not want the directed path to keep them engaged (both designs achieve this). If for instance you are getting more clicks on the secondary - then the primary button may not be the correct path at the stage. But I'm definitely interested in what others have to say about this/what testing may have been done.
Responding to your DMs

<@U2H1Q3F8R> I am with you. Its more about the primary path vs the secondary path. its funny how when suddenly now that there is a decision, we need all the marketing research in the world to prove there is a "better" option. I should have just picked and never said anything about it....
But your framing is helpful for the discussion. aka "whats the goal overall'
I also realized after what I wrote didn't answer at all what you were asking :laughing:
also the goal overall is not "to increase leads." I mean it is...but you know what I mean.:wink:
